statement.p: The beam from an ultrasonic testing probe spreads starting at the end of the near field. The angle of spread is given by \displaystyle{\sin{\theta}}={1.22}\frac{\lambda}{{D}} where \displaystyle\lambda is the wavelength and \displaystyle{D} is the diameter of the probe (crystal generating the vibration).

A straighter beam (smaller angle) is desirable for testing. What conditions are best for a straight beam? Note that for angles between 0@ and 90@ if we want a small angle we also want a small sine value.
